hackathon-description-text: Welcome to Hack K-State. Kansas State University's Second Annual Hackathon!
hackathon-eligibility: Students in High School and College are elegible to complete in teams of up to four members.
hackathon-requirements: Projects submissions may vary from a wide range of topics. All projects must be created at the event, but public open source code may be integrated into your projects.
hackathon-rules: We expect all hackers to adhere to the MLH Code of Conduct (http://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf).

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: All teams are eligible for this prize. Each member of the winning team will receive a Xbox One.
All teams are eligible for this prize. Each member of the winning team will receive an Amazon Echo
All teams are eligible for this prize. Each member of the winning team will receive a Corsair K70 Mechanical Keyboard
All teams are eligible for this prize. Each member of the winning team will receive a JetBrains license for PyCharm, WebStrom, AppCode, CLion or RubyMine.
Team members of the top 10 teams that did not place in the General theme win a one-year subscriptions to Wolfram|Alpha Pro.
All high school only teams are eligible for this prize. Each member of the winning team will receive a Pebble Time.
This years data hack focuses on big data and specifically its applications to healthcare. We have a novice and expert track but prizes will only be given for the expert track.
Any team that integrates the web or web technology is eligible to win a Google Cardboard and Google Chromecast for each team member.
Any team that creates a mobile app is eligible to win a Google Cardboard and Google Chromecast for each team member.
Teams that use the Watson IoT platform are eligible to win an Apple Watch for each member of the team.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of Watson IoT platform on Bluemix

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment. Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Win a HackHarassment Swag Bag.
Each member on the team that presents the best hack/website on a .TECH domain wins a $50 Amazon gift card.
Each member on the team that presents the best hack with Wolfram Tech receives:

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Each project will be guided by the themes they choose, but overall we are looking for projects that are unique, interesting, useful, and user friendly. (aka make something fun and enjoy yourself!)

hackathon-description-header: The annual hackathon at Kansas State University
